alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 2:03PM CDT until April 21 at 3:11AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Montgomery and Pike. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Meadville, Banks, Ansley, Kent, Troy Municipal Airport, Dublin, Grady, Ramer, Troy University, Linwood, Naftel, Strata, Sellers, Davenport, Orion, Currys and Sandfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
